summary: An example of using the in-built project page.
title: Internal Project

summary: We review the representative theories, algorithms and applications of the low rank subspace recovery models in data processing.
title: A Review on Low-Rank Models in Signal and Data Analysis

summary: We present a new method to automatically design CFAs in the frequency domain.
title: Automatic Design of Color Filter Arrays in the Frequency Domain

summary: We propose a new PDE framework, named learning to diffuse (LTD), to adaptively design the governing equation and the boundary condition of a diffusion PDE system for various vision tasks on different types of visual data.
title: Learning to Diffuse: A New Perspective to Design PDEs for Visual Analysis

summary: We propose to use a family of nonconvex surrogates of L 0 -norm on the singular values of a matrix to approximate the rank function.
title: Nonconvex Nonsmooth Low-Rank Minimization via Iteratively Reweighted Nuclear Norm

summary: We formulated the existing two-stage SSL problem into a unified optimization framework – termed as Self-Taught Semi-Supervised Learning (STSSL), in which both the given labels and the estimated labels are incorporated to refine the affinity matrix and to facilitate the unknown label estimation.
title: Learning Semi-Supervised Representation Towards a Unified Optimization Framework for Semi-Supervised Learning
Low-Rank Models in Signal and Data Processing: Theories, Algorithms, and Applications (in Chinese)

summary: We proposes a novel method to learn an undirected graph from a mixture of nonlinear manifolds via Locality-Preserving Low-Rank Representation (), which extents the original LRR model from linear subspaces to nonlinear manifolds.
title: Locality-Preserving Low-Rank Representation for Graph Construction from Nonlinear Manifolds

summary: We propose a dual graph regularized LRR model (DGLRR) by enforcing preservation of geometric information in both the ambient space and the feature space.
title: Dual Graph Regularized Latent Low-rank Representation for Subspace Clustering

summary: We propose a new algorithm, called fast alternating time-splitting approach (FATSA), to solve the linear combination coefficients.
title: A Fast Alternating Time-Splitting Approach for Learning Partial Differential Equations

summary: We present a fast and robust algorithm for solving ellipsoid-specific fitting directly. Our method is based on the alternating direction method of multipliers, which does not introduce extra positive semi-definiteness constraints.
title: Fast Multidimensional Ellipsoid-Specific Fitting by Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers

summary: We propose a general Laplacian regularized low-rank representation framework for data representation where a hypergraph Laplacian regularizer can be readily introduced into, i.e., a Non-negative Sparse Hyper-Laplacian regularized LRR model (NSHLRR).
title: Laplacian Regularized Low-Rank Representation and Its Applications

summary: We extend APG for general nonconvex and nonsmooth programs by introducing a monitor that satisfies the sufficient descent property
title: Accelerated Proximal Gradient Methods for Nonconvex Programming

summary: We formulate the tag completion problem in a subspace clustering model which assumes that images are sampled from subspaces, and complete the tags using the state-of-the-art Low Rank Representation (LRR) method.
title: Image Tag Completion and Refinement by Subspace Clustering and Matrix Completion

summary: We propose a multiple models fusion method to automatically recognize the expression in the video clip as part of the third Emotion Recognition in the Wild Challenge (EmotiW 2015).
title: Multiple Models Fusion for Emotion Recognition in the Wild

summary: We proposed a new minimization scheme aiming to find a better step size utilizing the first order information of the search curve.
title: Determining Step Sizes in Geometric Optimization Algorithms

summary: We present a supervised low-rank-based approach for learning discriminative features.
title: Integrated Low Rank Based Discriminative Feature Learning for Recognition

summary: We present a robust hybrid method that uses learning-based PDEs for detecting texts from natural scene images.
title: A Robust Hybrid Method for Text Detection in Natural Scenes by Learning-based Partial Differential Equations

summary: We proposed a new retraction for the quotient manifold used in R3MC, which is a geometric optimization algorithm for the matrix completion problem.
title: A New Retraction for Accelerating the Riemannian Three-Factor Low-Rank Matrix Completion Algorithm

summary: In this paper, we present a novel adaptive sharing method for image classification.
title: Adaptive Sharing for Image Classification

summary: In this paper, we propose a new subspace clustering method by employing the MoG model to describe the distribution of complex noise.
title: Subspace Clustering by Mixture of Gaussian Regression

summary: This paper aims at constructing a good graph to discover the intrinsic data structures under a semisupervised learning setting.
title: Multi-Level Discriminative Dictionary Learning With Application to Large Scale Image Classification

summary: We discover that once a solution to one of the models is obtained, we can obtain the solutions to other models in closed-form formulations. Since R-PCA is the simplest, our discovery makes it the center of low-rank subspace recovery models.
title: Relations among Some Low Rank Subspace Recovery Models

summary: We propose a nuclear-norm regularized regression model and use the alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM) to solve it.
title: Robust Nuclear Norm Regularized Regression for Face Recognition with Occlusion

summary: We propose a novel multi-level discriminative dictionary learning method and apply it to large scale image classification.
title: Multi-Level Discriminative Dictionary Learning With Application to Large Scale Image Classification

summary: Penrose demosaicking is more difficult than regular demosaicking, because none of the color components of the reconstructed regular color images are available. Therefore, most of the traditional demosaicking methods do not apply. We develop a sparse representation-based method for Penrose demosaicking.
title: Penrose Demosaicking

summary: We have investigated the exact recovery problem of R-PCA via Outlier Pursuit.
title: Exact Recoverability of Robust PCA via Outlier Pursuit with Tight Recovery Bounds

summary: This paper studied the Generalized Singular Value Thresholding (GSVT) operator associated with the nonconvex function g on the singular values.
title: Generalized Singular Value Thresholding

summary: We presents a general framework for solving the low-rank and/or sparse matrix minimization problems, which may involve multiple nonsmooth terms.
title: Smoothed Low Rank and Sparse Matrix Recovery by Iteratively Reweighted Least Squared Minimization

summary: We propose LADM with parallel splitting and adaptive penalty (LADMPSAP) to solve multi-block separable convex programs efficiently. We further propose a simple optimality measure and reveal the convergence rate of LADMPSAP in an ergodic sense.
title: Linearized Alternating Direction Method with Parallel Splitting and Adaptive Penalty for Separable Convex Programs in Machine Learning

summary: We have proposed a new global geometric verification method called LRGGC for partial-duplicate image search.
title: Low Rank Global Geometric Consistency for Partial-Duplicate Image Search

summary: This paper proposes the PIRE algorithm for solving the general optimization problem.
title: Proximal Iteratively Reweighted Algorithm with Multiple Splitting for Nonconvex Sparsity Optimization

summary: This paper develops a PDE system for saliency detection. We define a Linear Elliptic System with Dirichlet boundary (LESD) to model the saliency diffusion on an image and prove the submodularity of its solution.
title: Adaptive Partial Differential Equation Learning for Visual Saliency Detection

summary: In this work, the nonconvex surrogate functions of L_0-norm are extended on the singular values to approximate the rank function. It is observed that all the existing  nonconvex surrogate functions are concave and monotonically increasing on [0, \infty). Then a general solver IRNN is proposed.
title: Generalized Nonconvex Nonsmooth Low-Rank Minimization

summary: We addressed the problem of estimating 3D human poses from a single image and proposed a robust approach which is used in conjunction with an existing 2D pose detector.
title: Robust Estimation of 3D Human Poses from Single Images

summary: We intergrated error detection and error support into one regression model for sparse error coding and achieved the state-of-the-art results.
title: Robust Low-Rank Regularized Regression for Face Recognition with Occlusion

summary: In this paper, we analyze the grouping effect of representation based methods in depth.
title: Smooth Representation Clustering

summary: In this paper, we analyze the grouping effect of representation based methods in depth.
title: Smooth Representation Clustering

summary: We introduce a regularized MRW learning model, using a low-rank penalty to constrain the global subspace structure, for subspace clustering and estimation.
title: Learning Markov Random Walks for Robust Subspace Clustering and Estimation

summary: We proposed a tensor based low-rank representation for subspace clustering.
title: Tensor LRR Based Subspace Clustering

summary: We propose choosing the sparest solution in the solution set.
title: Robust Latent Low Rank Representation for Subspace Clustering

summary: We regard geodesic distance as a kind of kernel, which maps data from linearly inseparable space to linear separable distance space. In doing this, a new semisupervised manifold learning algorithm, namely regularized geodesic feature learning algorithm, is proposed.
title: A Regularized Approach for Geodesic Based Semi-Supervised Multi-Manifold Learning

summary: We propose a novel algorithm, called ℓ1 filtering, for exactly solving PCP with an  complexity, where m×n is the size of data matrix and r is the rank of the matrix to recover, which is supposed to be much smaller than m and n.
title: Linear time Principal Component Pursuit and its extensions using l1 Filtering

summary: We propose the Correlation Adaptive Subspace Segmentation (CASS) method by using the trace Lasso.
title: Correlation Adaptive Subspace Segmentation by Trace Lasso

summary: We study the robust subspace clustering problem, and present a general framework from the viewpoint of half-quadratic optimization to unify the L1 norm, Frobenius norm, L21 norm and nuclear norm based subspace clustering methods.
title: Correntropy Induced L2 Graph for Robust Subspace Clustering

summary: We propose linearized alternating direction method with parallel splitting and adaptive penalty for efficiently solving linearly constrained multi-variable separable convex programs, which are abundant in machine learning.
title: Linearized Alternating Direction Method with Parallel Splitting and Adaptive Penalty for Separable Convex Programs in Machine Learning
Rank Minimization: Theories, Algorithms, and Applications (in Chinese)

summary: With the L1-norm discriminant criterion, we propose a new linear discriminant analysis (L1-LDA) method for linear feature extraction problem.
title: L1-Norm Kernel Discriminant Analysis Via Bayes Error Bound Optimization for Robust Feature Extraction

summary: We conclude that even for rank minimization problems as simple as noiseless LatLRR, replacing rank with nuclear norm is not valid and LatLRR is actually problematic because the solution to its nuclear norm minimization formation is not unique in this paper
title: A Counterexample for The Validaity of Using Nuclear Norm as A Comvex Surrogate of Rank

summary: Based on stroke width transform and texture invariant low-rank transform, we propose a framework that can detect and rectify texts in arbitrary orientations in the image against complex backgrounds
title: Transform Invariant Text Extraction

summary: We have presented an effective method for rectifying Chinese and English characters or words as robust low-rank textures.
title: Rectification of Optical Characters as Transform Invariant Low-rank Textures

summary: We propose a novel algorithm to speed up solving TILT, with guaranteed convergence for the inner loop.
title: Linearized Alternating Direction Method with Adaptive Penalty and Warm Starts for Fast Solving Transform Invariant Low-Rank Textures

summary: We propose a novel regularized Semi-Supervised Latent Dirichlet Allocation (r-SSLDA) for learning visual concept classifiers.
title: Regularized Semi-Supervised Latent Dirichlet Allocation for visual concept learning

summary: we propose a novel objective function named Low-Rank Representation (LRR), which seeks the lowest rank representation among all the candidates that can represent the data samples as linear combinations of the bases in a given dictionary.
title: Robust Recovery of Subspace Structures by Low-Rank Representation

summary: We have proposed a new multi-manifold learning algorithm, which combines semi-supervised multimanifold modeling, nonlinear feature extraction and a new semi-supervised discriminant analysis method to achieve better performance in geodesic feature extraction and classification tasks.
title: Geodesic based semi-supervised multi-manifold feature extraction
Perceptual Thumbnail Generation

summary: We review some typical algorithms,Iteratively Reweighted ℓ1 minimization(IRL1),Iteratively Reweighted Least Squares(IRLS) (and its general form General Iteratively Reweighted Least Squares(GIRLS)), and Iteratively Thresholding Method(ITM), forℓp minimization and do comprehensive comparison among them, in which IRLS is identified as having the bestperformance and being the fastest as well.
title: A comparison of typical ℓp minimization algorithms

summary: We propose an algorithm, called Bases Sorting, to sort the bases of over-complete dictionaries used in sparse representation according to the magnitudes of coefficients when representing the training samples.
title: Bases sorting: Generalizing the concept of frequency for over-complete dictionaries

summary: This paper proposed a novel framework, named fixedrank representation (FRR), for robust unsupervised visual learning.
title: Fixed-Rank Representation for Unsupervised Visual Learning

summary: This paper proposes a novel informative graph, called the nonnegative low rank and sparse graph (NNLRS-graph), for graph-based semi-supervised learning.
title: Non-Negative Low Rank and Sparse Graph for Semi-Supervised Learning

summary: We propose a new discriminant subspace analysis (DSA) method for the multi-class feature extraction problems.
title: A new discriminant subspace analysis approach for multi-class problems

summary: We proposed new algorithms for GVF and GGVF computation. Our methods are comparable with the MGVF method, and are more simple. We applied the proposed methods to GVF snake for image segmentation. GVF-based anisotropic diffusion model confirms the validity of our new methods.
title: Fast gradient vector flow computation based on augmented Lagrangian method

summary: We propose a linearized alternating direction method with adaptive penalty for solving subproblems in ADM conveniently
title: Linearized Alternating Direction Method with Adaptive Penalty for Low-Rank Representation

summary: This paper proposes a generalized accelerated prox- imal gradient (GAPG) approach for solving total variation (TV) based image restoration problems.
title: A Generalized Accelerated Proximal Gradient Approach for Total Variation-Based Image Restoration

summary: We introduce a PDE-based optimal control framework for PDEs design.
title: Toward designing intelligent PDEs for computer vision An optimal control approach

summary: This technical report introduces some software packages for partial SVD computation, including optimized PROPACK, modified PROPACK for computing singular values above a threshold and the corresponding singular vectors, and block Lanczos with warm start (BLWS). The current version is preliminary. The details will be enriched soon.
title: Some Software Packages for Partial SVD Computation

summary: We analyze and improve low rank representation (LRR), the state-of-the-art algorithm for subspace segmentation of data.
title: Analysis and Improvement of Low Rank Representation for Subspace segmentation

summary: We present a novel approach to reconstruction-based super-resolution that uses aperiodic pixel tilings, such as a Penrose tiling or a biological retina, for improved performance.
title: Penrose Pixels for Super-Resolution

summary: We propose a novel algorithm, called Semisupervised Semi-Riemannian Metric Map (S^3RMM), following the geometric framework of semi- Riemannian manifolds
title: Learning Semi-Riemannian Metrics for Semisupervised Feature Extraction

summary: We present a CFA design methodology in the frequency domain. The frequency structure, which is shown to be just the symbolic DFT of the CFA pattern (one period of the CFA), is introduced to represent im- ages sampled with any rectangular CFAs in the frequency domain.
title: A Geometric Method for Optimal Design of Color Filter Arrays

summary: This article introduces the frequency structure matrix as a new representation of color filter arrays (CFAs).
title: The Frequency Structure Matrix: A Representation of Color Filter Arrays

summary: We propose using the block Lanczos method to compute the partial SVDs, where the principal singular subspaces obtained in the previous iteration are used to start the block Lanczos procedure.
title: A Block Lanczos with Warm Start Technique for Accelerating Nuclear Norm Minimization Algorithms

summary: We develop a supervised dimensionality reduction method, called Lorentzian discriminant projection(LDP), for feature extraction and classification
title: Feature Extraction by Learning Lorentzian Metric Tensor and Its Extensions

summary: We have proposed a new method to address the emotion recognition problem from arbitrary view facial images.
title: Emotion Recognition from Arbitrary View Facial Images

summary: We have presented a framework of learning PDEs from training data for image restoration.
title: Learning PDEs for Image Restoration via Optimal Control

summary: In this work we propose the low-rank representation (LRR) to recover the lowest-rank representation of a set of data vectors in a joint way, i.e., to recover the lowest-rank representation of matrix data.
title: Robust Subspace Segmentation by Low-Rank Representation

summary: In this work, we address the problem of performing class-specific unsupervised object segmentation, i.e., automatic segmentation without annotated training images.
title: Unsupervised Object Segmentation with a Hybrid Graph Model
Aperiodic pixel layout for super-resolution (Invited Paper)

summary: We propose a fast algorithm for solving the KFSODVs, which is based on rank-one update (ROU) of the eigensytems.
title: A Rank-One Update Algorithm for Fast Solving Kernel Foley-Sammon Optimal Discriminant Vectors

summary: Motivated by the success of coding-based palmprint recognition methods, this paper investigates a compact representation of multiscale palm line orientation features, and proposes a novel method called the sparse multiscale competitive code (SMCC).
title: The Multiscale Competitive Code via Sparse Representation for Palmprint Verification

summary: This paper proposes a new approach to theoretically analyze compressive sensing directly from the randomly sampling matrix phi instead of a certain recovery algorithm. Taking anyone of source bits, we can constitute a tree by parsing the randomly sampling matrix, where the selected source bit as the root.
title: Tree Structure Based Analyses on Compressive Sensing for Binary Sparse Sources

summary: This paper studies algorithms for solving the problem of recovering a low-rank matrix with a fraction of its entries arbitrarily corrupted. This paper develops and compares two complementary approaches for solving this problem by a convex programming. The first is an accelerated proximal gradient algorithm directly applied to the primal; while the second is a gradient algorithm applied to the dual problem.
title: Fast Algorithms for Recovering a Corrupted Low-Rank Matrix

summary: In this paper, we focus on JPEG images and propose detecting tampered images by examining the double quantization effect hidden among the discrete cosine transform (DCT) coefficients.
title: Fast, Automatic and Fine-Grained Tampered JPEG Images Detection via DCT Coefficient Analysis

summary: In this paper, we consider the output space as a Riemannian submanifold to incorporate its geometric structure into the regression process.
title: Multi-output regression on the output manifold

summary: This paper proposes scalable and fast algorithms for solving the Robust PCA problem, namely recovering a low-rank matrix with an unknown fraction of its entries being arbitrarily corrupted.
title: The Augmented Lagrange Multiplier Method for Exact Recovery of Corrupted Low-Rank Matrix

summary: In this paper, we propose the tensor linear Laplacian discrimination (TLLD) algorithm for extracting discriminant features from tensor data.
title: Tensor linear Laplacian discrimination (TLLD) for feature extraction

summary: We propose a framework for learning a system of PDEs from real data.
title: Designing Partial Differential Equations for Image Processing by Combining Differential Invariants

summary: This paper studies algorithms for solving the problem of recovering a low-rank matrix with a fraction of its entries arbitrarily corrupted.
title: Fast Convex Optimization Algorithms for Exact Recovery of a Corrupted Low-Rank Matrix
Learning-Based Image Superresolution Algorithms (in Chinese)
Signature Sample Synthesis

summary: In this paper, we aim to handle the intraclass variation resulting from the geometric transformation and the illumination change for more robust texture classification.
title: Radon Representation-Based Feature Descriptor for Texture Classification

summary: We present a simple new criterion for classification, based on principles from lossy data compression.
title: Classification via Minimum Incremental Coding Length

summary: We propose a novel approach to expression recognition from non-frontal view facial images. Under the unified Bayes theoretical framework, the recognition problem can be formulated as an optimization problem of minimizing an upper bound of Bayes error.
title: A Novel Approach to Expression Recognition from Non-frontal Face Images

summary: We propose to use a bipartite graph to represent compressive sensing (CS). We derive the close-form formulation of the evolution of the bipartite graph in statistics, which enable us to more accurately analyze the performance of compressive sensing.
title: Analysis on Rate-distortion Performance of Compressive Sensing for Binary Sparse Source

summary: We develops a supervised dimensionality reduction method, Lorentzian Discriminant Projection (LDP), for discriminant analysis and classification. Our method represents the structures of sample data by a manifold, which is furnished with a Lorentzian metric tensor.
title: Lorentzian Discriminant Projection and Its Applications

summary: We generalize the two-class common spatio-spectral patterns (CSSPs) method to multi-class cases on the electroencephalogram (EEG) classification.
title: Optimizing Multi-class Spatio-Spectral Filters via Bayes Error Estimation for EEG Classification

summary: We propose a new criterion for designing the regularizing filter to solve an ill-posed problem and this criterion reveals the implicit assumption made by regularizing filters.
title: Refined Exponential Filter with Applications to Image Restoration and Interpolation
Learning Partial Differential Equations for Computer Vision

summary: In this paper, we propose perceptual image preview which retains more perceptual features such that users can inspect features of interest by viewing the preview image only and without zooming in.
title: Perceptual Image Preview

summary: This paper is the first attempt to shed some light on this problem when the SR algorithms are designed for general natural images.
title: Limits of Learning-Based Superresolution Algorithms
Color Filter Arrays: A Design Methodology
Color Filter Arrays: Representation and Analysis

summary: In this paper, we propose a framework for learning a system of PDEs from real data to accomplish a specific vision task.
title: Learning Partial Differential Equations for Computer Vision

summary: We proposed a novel approach to approximate an area light source with a point light source for each component of the shading model.
title: One-Shot Approximate Local Shading

summary: In this article, we propose techniques for modeling and rendering of heterogeneous translucent materials that enable acquisition from measured samples, interactive editing of material attributes, and real-time rendering.
title: Modeling and Rendering of Heterogeneous Translucent Materials Using the Diffusion Equation

summary: We develop a geometric framework for linear or nonlinear discriminant subspace learning and classification. In our framework, the structures of classes are conceptualized as a semi-Riemannian manifold which is considered as a submanifold embedded in an ambient semi-Riemannian space.
title: Classification via Semi-Riemannian Spaces
Real-Time Rendering of Realistic Rain

summary: This paper presents a novel and effective approach to synthesize English handwriting in the user’s writing style.
title: Style-preserving English handwriting synthesis

summary: In this paper, we describe a system that allows the user to quickly and easily produce a compelling-looking animation from a small collection of high resolution stills.
title: High Resolution Animated Scenes from Stills

summary: We address the problem of performing class specific unsupervised object segmentation by employing a hybrid graph model (HGM) to integrate recognition and segmentation into a unified process.
title: A Hybrid Graph Model for Unsupervised Object Segmentation

summary: We present a simple new criterion for classification, based on principles from lossy data compression. The criterion assigns a test sample to the class that uses the minimum number of additional bits to code the test sample, subject to an allowable distortion.
title: Classification via Minimum Incremental Coding Length (MICL)

summary: We develop a new structural perception of data based on local contexts by identifying the contextual set, defining the contextual distance, and using a directed graph.
title: Contextual Distance for Data Perception

summary: We develop the Laplacian PCA (LPCA) algorithm which is the extension of PCA to a more general form by locally optimizing the weighted scatter. In addition to the simplicity of PCA, the benefits brought by LPCA are twofold: the strong robustness against noise and the weak metric-dependence on sample spaces.
title: Laplacian PCA and Its Applications

summary: Under our theoretical framework, we could estimate the limits of learning-based SR algorithms.
title: Limits of Learning-Based Superresolution Algorithms

summary: We propose the linear Laplacian discrimination (LLD) algorithm/or discriminant feature extraction, which is an extension of linear discriminant analysis (LDA). Our motivation is to address the issue that LDA cannot work well in cases where sample spaces are non-Euclidean.
title: Linear Laplacian Discrimination for Feature Extraction

summary: We present a novel approach to reconstruction based super-resolution that explicitly models the detector's pixel layout and a new variant of the well known error back-projection super-resolution algorithm that makes use of the exact detector model in its back projection operator for better accuracy.
title: Penrose Pixels: Super-Resolution in the Detector Layout Domain

summary: In this paper, we present a robust system which is capable of detecting tables from free style online ink notes and extracting their structure so that they can be further edited in multiple ways.
title: Table Detection in Online Ink Notes
Real-Time Rendering of Realistic Rain

summary: We present our ink cleanup system that removes the smear and correction, so that the document becomes cleaner and more legible and the handwriting recognition rate could also be improved.
title: Rule-based cleanup of on-line English ink notes

summary: In this paper, we show that, when the perturbation theorem is invalid, the probability of successful superresolution is very low
title: Response to Comments on Fundamental Limits of Reconstruction-Based Superresolution Algorithms under Local Translation

summary: We propose an approach that can detect doctored JPEG images and further locate the doctored parts, by examining the double quantization effect hidden among the DCT coefficients.
title: Detecting Doctored JPEG Images via DCT Coefficient Analysis

summary: In this paper, we achieve high quality antialiasing by using signal processing and sampling theory and proposing a first order approximating filter.
title: First Order Approximation for Texture Filtering

summary: To render realistic rain in real-time, videos of real rain are analyzed to extract the rain mattes; random samples of these rain stroke mattes are then used for online synthesis. We incorporate pre-computed radiance transfer (PRT) in our particle system to take into account the scene radiance.
title: Real-Time Rendering of Realistic Rain

summary: To differentiate real images/videos from doctored ones, we propose an approach that computes the response functions of the camera by selecting appropriate patches in different ways.
title: Detecting Doctored Images Using Camera Response Normality and Consistency

summary: To make signature verification more accurate, we construct a system, which is composed of a simplified GMM model for global signature features, and a discrete HMM model for local signature features.
title: On-Line Signature Verification With Two-Stage Statistical Models

summary: In this paper, we present a family of circular or square optimal polynomial filters for pre-filtering 2D polygons and images.
title: Optimal Polynomial Filters

summary: In this paper, an improved algorithm for pre-filtering 2D polygons is presented.
title: Pre-filtering 2D Polygons without Clipping

summary: In this paper,we adopt a geometric approach to investigate the minimum sampling problem for light field rendering, with and without geometry information of the scene.
title: A Geometric Analysis of Light Field Rendering

summary: In this paper, we focus on a major class of superresolution algorithms, called the reconstruction-based algorithms, which compute high-resolution images by simulating the image formation process.
title: Fundamental Limits of Reconstruction-Based Superresolution Algorithms under Local Translation

summary: We propose a correction and rectification framework that uses only four images to capture a light field.
title: Correction and rectification of light fields

summary: This paper presents an off-line signature verification system that only requires the genuine signatures of a new user.
title: Off-line Signature Verification Incorporating the Prior Model

summary: This paper presents a new approach for off-line signature verification with Boosting algorithm.
title: Signature verification using integrated classifiers

summary: We define a representation called the reflected irradiance field which records the light reflected from a scene as viewed at a fixed viewpoint as a result of moving a point light source on a plane.
title: Relighting with the Reflected Irradiance Field: Representation, Sampling and Reconstruction

summary: We propose a correction and rectification framework that uses only four images to capture an ideal light field.
title: Correction and Rectification of Light Fields

summary: This paper provides explicit limits for a major class of super-resolution algorithms, called reconstruction-based algorithms, under both real and synthetic conditions.
title: On the Fundamental Limits of Reconstruction-Based Super-resolution Algorithms

summary: We study the minimum sampling problem of the reflected irradiance field, i.e., how many light source positions are needed.
title: Relighting with the Reflected Irradiance Field: Representation, Sampling and Reconstruction

summary: This paper is the first attempt to investigate the lower bound for the number of samples needed in the Lumigraph/light field rendering. The bounds are derived completely from the aspect of geometry and are closely related to the resolution of the camera and the depth range of the scene.
title: On the Number of Samples Needed in Light Field Rendering with Constant-depth Assumption

summary: An image denoising operator defined by a non-linear partial differential equation(PDE) is presented, which can remove noise, enhance step-like edges and keep the locality of the edges.
title: An Anisotropic Diffusion PDE for Noise Reduction and Thin Edge Preservation
Constrained Optimal Control of Continuous Casting

summary: The theory of elasticity is applied to study numerically the bulging behavior of the shell between consecutive supporting rollers. Considering the geometry of the steel slab, both heat transfer and stress analysis are simplified to two-dimensional problems.
title: Numerical Analysis of the Bulging of Continuously Cast Slabs
